intro: Phrynium tapirorum, commonly known as the tapir's ear, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its striking, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces a spadix inflorescence surrounded by a colorful spathe, typical of many aroid species. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Phrynium tapirorum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
